definition: to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Venture capital transmogrified into speculative fever.
sentences.chinese: 风险资本改头换面进入投机热。

sentences.english: As the face of America has changed, so has the face of American racism.
sentences.chinese: 随着美国的面貌改变，美国种族主义也改头换面了。

sentences.english: My duff transcript did not faze the schools I applied to.
sentences.chinese: 我那份改头换面的成绩单，并没有引起商学院的疑虑。

sentences.english: The company intends to re-fashion itself as AIU Holdings.
sentences.chinese: 公司打算改头换面作为美亚保险公司控股有限公司。

sentences.english: In debt restructuring, the existing debt is metaphorically torn up and replaced by new debt.
sentences.chinese: 在债务重组方面，旧债改头换面被新债取代。

sentences.english: What this suggests is that education and healthcare are ripe for disruptive innovation.
sentences.chinese: 以上现象表明教育和医疗正亟待一场改头换面的革新。

sentences.english: They are being shown at the Reinventing Shoe exhibition at La Capella dels Angels.
sentences.chinese: 这场奇异鞋展的名字叫作“改头换面的鞋子”。

sentences.english: He was believed to have altered his appearance and traveled throughout Europe, Mexico, Canada and the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他改头换面后流窜到过欧洲，墨西哥，加拿大和美国。

sentences.english: An official revision of history was quietly taking place.
sentences.chinese: 官方历史就这样不声不响地改头换面了。

sentences.english: A few simple techniques can make a big difference when your PC's performance slows to a crawl.
sentences.chinese: 只要一些简单的技巧就能让你的龟速电脑改头换面了。

sentences.english: I’m most excited about the innovation of Phones That Don’t Suck.
sentences.chinese: 让我最兴奋的是改头换面的手机的发明。

definition: to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
to change shape in a single shake/fig. to take on a new lease of life
to start over from scratch (idiom)
different broth but the same old medicine (idiom); a change in name only/a change in form but not in substance
(of a person) to return to the fray after a period of inactivity/to jump back into the thick of things/(of sth that was once popular) to be resurrected/to make a comeback
to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
bird shotgun replaced by cannon (idiom); equipment improved enormously
complete change (idiom); facelift/We're in a wholly new situation.
lit. to shake one's body/refers to abrupt transformation/same as 搖身一變|摇身一变
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
bold and decisive
to dress up in disguise (idiom); to pretend for the purpose of deceit
lit. from head to tail (idiom); thoroughgoing/through and through/out and out/from top to bottom
(lit. and fig.) overnight
to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
to resume one's old trade (idiom)
